hints.content:
When we add a number, we jump that distance to the right on the number line.

To show $\blueD{7} + \blueD{7} + \blueD{7} + \blueD{7}$, we need to show $\maroonD{4}$ jumps of $\blueD{7}$ units.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 28 with tick marks at 7, 14, 21, and 28. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 7, 14, 21, and 28. Each arrow is labeled plus 7. !

hints.content:
This number line best represents $4\times7$:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 28 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 7, 14, 21, and 28. !
